means: 最好的( good和well的最高级)
最好的东西，最合乎要求的事物
贝斯特，查尔斯·赫伯特((1899-1978) 美裔加拿大生理学家，因其对胰岛素的发现与应用方面的工作而著名)
Business EDP System Technique 商用电子数据处理系统技术

sentence.Network_en: The best thing to do when entering unknown territory is smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 踏入未知地带最好的对策就是微笑。

sentence.Network_en: The happiest are not those who own all the best things, but those who can appreciate the beauty of life.
sentence.Network_cn: 最幸福的人们并不一定什么都是最好，只是他们懂得欣赏生活的美好。

sentence.Network_en: Some companies are cutting costs and hoping for the best.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些公司在削减成本，希望一切好转。

jx.jx_en_mean: said or written to wish a person well on ending a letter or parting
jx.jx_cn_mean: 祝一切顺利，美好的祝愿（书信结尾或道别时用语）

jx.jx_en_mean: as effectively as possible under the circumstances

lj.lj_ly: I went about my job as best I could.

jx.jx_en_mean: even in the most favourable circumstances

lj.lj_ly: his memory is poor at the best of times.
lj.lj_ls: 即使在最好的时候，他记性也很差。

phrase.cizu_name: be for (或 all for) the best

jx.jx_en_mean: be desirable in the end, although not at first seeming so
jx.jx_cn_mean: （初时虽则不妙）最终结果还是理想的

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)the rib end of a neck of lamb or other meat

phrase.cizu_name: the best-laid plans of mice and men gang aft agley

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)even the most careful planning doesn't necessarily ensure success. gang
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)即使是最周密详尽的计划也未必能确保成功，计划再好也未必成功

lj.lj_ly: in the tradition of all best-laid plans, subsequent events overturned the scheme.
lj.lj_ls: 正如一切最周密详尽的计划一样，随后发生的事情使这一阴谋失败了。

phrase.cizu_name: the best of three (或 five 等)

jx.jx_en_mean: victory achieved by winning the majority of a specified odd number of games
jx.jx_cn_mean: 三局两胜（或五局三胜等）

lj.lj_ly: it took them the best part of 10 years.
lj.lj_ls: 他们十年中的大部分时间都花在这上面。

jx.jx_en_mean: an expression of hope for someone's future happiness or welfare, often written at the end of a letter
jx.jx_cn_mean: “万事如意！"（常写在信尾处，表示祝愿）

jx.jx_en_mean: the most vigorous and productive period of one's life; one's prime

lj.lj_ly: Ruth &B{did her best to} reassure her.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  betest (adjective), betost, betst (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German best, also to better

encyclopedia.content: 形容词a. (good和well的最高级) 1. 最好的；最熟练的；道德最高尚的 I think John's plan is best. 我认为约翰的方案最好。 2. 最适当的；最有效的 The best thing for you would be to forget it. 你最好是把这事儿忘了。 3. 最大的；主要的 It took the best part of a day to get there. 花了大半天时间才到达那里。 副词ad. (well的最高级) 1. 最好地；最适当地；最有效地 I think Friday would suit me best. 我想星期五对我

entry.def: Best is the superlative of good .

example.ex: If you want further information the best thing to do is have a word with the driver as you get on the bus...
example.tran: 如果你想了解更多信息，最好的办法是在上公交车时问一问司机。

example.ex: It's not the best place to live if you wish to develop your knowledge and love of mountains.
example.tran: 如果你想增长知识、培养登山爱好的话，这可不是最好的地方。

entry.def: Best is the superlative of well .

example.ex: James Fox is best known as the author of White Mischief.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·福克斯以《欲望城》一书最为出名。

entry.def: The best is used to refer to things of the highest quality or standard.

example.ex: We offer only the best to our clients...
example.tran: 我们只把最好的服务提供给客户。

example.ex: He'll have the best of care.
example.tran: 他会得到最好的照顾。

entry.tran: 最大努力；最高成就；最好水平
entry.def: Someone's best is the greatest effort or highest achievement or standard that they are capable of.

example.ex: Miss Blockey was at her best when she played the piano...
example.tran: 布洛基小姐弹钢琴的时候发挥了她的最好水平。

example.ex: One needs to be a first-class driver to get the best out of that sort of machinery.
example.tran: 只有一流的司机才能让那种机器发挥出最大的功效。

entry.def: If you say that something is the best that can be done or hoped for, you think it is the most pleasant, successful, or useful thing that can be done or hoped for.

example.ex: A draw seems the best they can hope for...
example.tran: 看来他们顶多只能指望打个平局了。

example.ex: The best we can do is try to stay cool and muddle through.
example.tran: 我们能做的顶多就是设法保持冷静，蒙混过关。

entry.def: If you like something best or like it the best, you prefer it.

example.ex: The thing I liked best about the show was the music...
example.tran: 这场演出中我最喜欢的是它的音乐。

example.ex: Mother liked it best when Daniel got money...
example.tran: 丹尼尔拿到钱的时候，母亲是最高兴的。

entry.tran: （用于构成以good和well开头的复合形容词的最高级，如well-known的最高级为best-known）
entry.def: Best is used to form the superlative of compound adjectives beginning with 'good' and 'well'. For example, the superlative of 'well-known' is 'best-known'.

entry.tran: （用于道别或信件末尾）万事如意，一切顺利
entry.def: You can say 'All the best' when you are saying goodbye to someone, or at the end of a letter.

example.ex: Wish him all the best, and tell him we miss him.
example.tran: 祝他一切顺利，告诉他我们想念他。

entry.def: You use best of all to indicate that what you are about to mention is the thing that you prefer or that has most advantages out of all the things you have mentioned.

example.ex: It was comfortable and cheap: best of all, most of the rent was being paid by two American friends.
example.tran: 房子既舒适又便宜：最妙的是，大部分租金是由两位美国朋友支付的。

entry.tran: 尽全力；竭尽所能；尽最大努力
entry.def: If someone does something as best they can, they do it as well as they can, although it is very difficult.

example.ex: The older people were left to carry on as best they could.
example.tran: 年纪大一点的人被留下来，奋力坚持。

entry.def: You use at best to indicate that even if you describe something as favourably as possible or if it performs as well as it possibly can, it is still not very good.

example.ex: This policy, they say, is at best confused and at worst non-existent...
example.tran: 有人说这项政策往好里说是混乱不堪，往坏里说就是形同虚设。

example.ex: At best they were effective as antidepressants for no more than four months.
example.tran: 它们充其量也只能起到4个月的抗抑郁剂的效果。

entry.def: If you do your best or try your best to do something, you try as hard as you can to do it, or do it as well as you can.

example.ex: I'll do my best to find out...
example.tran: 我会尽力查明真相。

example.ex: It wasn't her fault, she was trying her best to help...
example.tran: 这不是她的错，她是尽力帮忙的。

entry.def: If you say that something is for the best, you mean it is the most desirable or helpful thing that could have happened or could be done, considering all the circumstances.

example.ex: In the long run, it was for the best...
example.tran: 长远来说，这是最好的。

example.ex: Whatever the circumstances, parents are supposed to know what to do for the best.
example.tran: 不论在什么情况下，父母都应该知道怎样做才是最好的。

entry.tran: （尤指冰释前嫌后）最好的朋友；知己
entry.def: If two people are the best of friends, they are close friends, especially when they have had a disagreement or fight in the past.

example.ex: Magda is now married to George Callerby and we are the best of friends.
example.tran: 玛格达现在已经和乔治·卡勒比结婚了，我们成了最好的朋友。

entry.tran: 最好（有些人认为此用法不规范）
entry.def: If you say that someone had best do something or that they'd best do it, you mean they ought to do it. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

example.ex: You'd best take a look.
example.tran: 你最好还是看一看。

entry.def: If you say that a particular person knows best, you mean that they have a lot of experience and should therefore be trusted to make decisions for other people.

example.ex: He was convinced that doctors and dentists knew best.
example.tran: 他确信医生和牙医最清楚该怎么做。

entry.tran: 看起来处于自己最迷人的状态
entry.def: If you look your best, you are looking as smart and attractive as you can.

example.ex: I made sure I was very clean and looking my best.
example.tran: 我把自己收拾得十分整洁，美丽动人。

entry.tran: 乐观地尽可能利用（逆境）
entry.def: If you make the best of something, you accept an unsatisfactory situation cheerfully and try to manage as well as you can. In British English, you can also say that you make the best of a bad job .

example.ex: She instilled in the children the virtues of good hard work, and making the best of what you have.
example.tran: 她慢慢给孩子们灌输勤奋工作的品德，教导他们充分利用现有的条件。

means.word_mean: 1. the supreme effort one can make;
2. the person who is most outstanding or excellent; someone who tops all others;

sentences.sentence: "he could beat the best of them"
"the goal was to best the competition"

means.word_mean: 1. (superlative of `good') having the most positive qualities;
2. (comparative and superlative of `well') wiser or more advantageous and hence advisable;

sentences.sentence: "it would be better to speak to him"
"the White House thought it best not to respond"

means.word_mean: 1. in a most excellent way or manner;

sentences.sentence: "he played best after a couple of martinis"

means.word_mean: 3. from a position of superiority or authority;

auth_sentence.content: Most matches will be the best of three sets.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most matches will be the best of three sets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most matches will be the best of three sets.

auth_sentence.content: Who was the best player you have played with?
auth_sentence.res_content: Who was the best player you have played with?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Who was the best player you have played with?

auth_sentence.content: This is probably what Wherry and Teeber do best.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is probably what Wherry and Teeber do best.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is probably what Wherry and Teeber do best.

sentences.en: Lucy is the best person to fill this secretary vacancy.
sentences.cn: 露西是秘书这个空缺的最佳人选。

sentences.en: Whoever does best will get the prize.
sentences.cn: 谁做得最出色谁就得奖。

means.word_mean: 最好的东西; 最好的人

sentences.en: He is the best in the class.
sentences.cn: 他是班上最优秀的学生。

sentences.en: Joe was bested in the debate.

jushi.english: What is the best way to harden off new rose bushes only a few inches high?
jushi.chinese: 要想使只有几英寸高的玫瑰长壮以移植户外,什么办法最好?

jushi.english: He is the best person for the job.
jushi.chinese: 他是最适合做这项工作的人。

jushi.english: We flatter ourselves that we provide the best service in town.
jushi.chinese: 我们相信我们提供的服务在本市最好。
